CatDescriptText: Mr. Jack Shea, recently discharged serviceman, of Elliott, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 18, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think taverns should be permitted to remain open and dispense alcohol beverages until at least 2 A.M. Sundays? Do you favor the sale of beer and wine on Sundays in Pennsylvania, like some other states permit?" answer reads: "It sounds all right to me for the taverns to remain open until 2 A.M.  As I see it, there are a lot of people who are out at that time.  And I see no reason why the taverns should not be open on Sunday."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Jack Shea wearing striped short sleeved shirt with cuffs rolled up and light colored t-shirt, standing outside of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
